page.title: 19THE GREAT FLOOD
page.content: {Saturday, 3rd November,1984. It is hard to believe that no one was drowned that day Jed played West of Scotland.The main flooding was around Bankend,Butler's garage,Thuleknit and Riverside.The Jed overflowed at Bankend and roared up the A68 to the Jedforest north car park. During the game,Elliot Park flooded and it was those who lingered in the bar after the match who were caught. They were rescued by a four wheel drive tractor and trailer.Two cars trying to escape from the car park were carried into a gully by the force of water turning off tha A68.The drivers were hauled out only in the nick of time.The Riverside premises were extensively damaged by the water. The worst of the flooding occurred around 6.30 in the darkness of the November night.
